refnamediv.refpurpose: A set of features in caps

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GstCapsFeatures can optionally be set on a GstCaps to add requirements for additional features for a specific GstStructure. Caps structures with the same name but with a non-equal set of caps features are not compatible. If a pad supports multiple sets of features it has to add multiple equal structures with different feature sets to the caps.

Empty GstCapsFeatures are equivalent with the GstCapsFeatures that only contain GST_CAPS_FEATURE_MEMORY_SYSTEM_MEMORY. ANY GstCapsFeatures as created by gst_caps_features_new_any() are equal to any other GstCapsFeatures and can be used to specify that any GstCapsFeatures would be supported, e.g. for elements that don't touch buffer memory. GstCaps with ANY GstCapsFeatures are considered non-fixed and during negotiation some GstCapsFeatures have to be selected.

Examples for caps features would be the requirement of a specific GstMemory types or the requirement of having a specific GstMeta on the buffer. Features are given as a string of the format "memory:GstMemoryTypeName" or "meta:GstMetaAPIName".

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_new ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstCapsFeatures with the given features. The last argument must be NULL.

entry.para: name of first feature to set

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_new_any ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new, ANY GstCapsFeatures. This will be equal to any other GstCapsFeatures but caps with these are unfixed.

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_new_id ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstCapsFeatures with the given features. The last argument must be 0.

entry.para: name of first feature to set

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_new_id_valist ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstCapsFeatures with the given features.

entry.para: name of first feature to set

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_new_valist ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GstCapsFeatures with the given features.

entry.para: name of first feature to set

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_copy ()
refsect2.para: Duplicates a GstCapsFeatures and all its values.

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_free ()
refsect2.para: Frees a GstCapsFeatures and all its values. The caps features must not have a parent when this function is called.

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_from_string ()
refsect2.para: Creates a GstCapsFeatures from a string representation.

entry.para: a string representation of a GstCapsFeatures.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new GstCapsFeatures or NULL when the string could not be parsed. Free with gst_caps_features_free() after use.

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_to_string ()
refsect2.para: Converts features to a human-readable string representation.
For debugging purposes its easier to do something like this:
This prints the features in human readable form.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a pointer to string allocated by g_malloc(). g_free() after usage.

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_set_parent_refcount ()
refsect2.para: Sets the parent_refcount field of GstCapsFeatures. This field is used to determine whether a caps features is mutable or not. This function should only be called by code implementing parent objects of GstCapsFeatures, as described in the MT Refcounting section of the design documents.

entry.para: a pointer to the parent's refcount.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if the parent refcount could be set.

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_is_equal ()
refsect2.para: Check if features1 and features2 are equal.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: TRUE if features1 and features2 are equal.

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_get_size ()
refsect2.para: Returns the number of features in features .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The number of features in features .

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_get_nth ()
refsect2.para: Returns the i -th feature of features .

refsect2.title: gst_caps_features_get_nth_id ()
refsect2.para: Returns the i -th feature of features .
